main

Class Flag

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Flag

  • public class Flag
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to parse parameters passed to a program using the command line.
    Author:
    Nelphindal

      • parse

        public final boolean parse(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parses given args and assigns the value to the registered flagIds.
        Parameters:
        args - parameters to parse
        Returns:
        true if args were valid and parsing successful

      • printHelp

        public final java.lang.String printHelp()
        Generates a message containing all registered flags, allowing the user to choose the parameters to pass to the program.
        Returns:
        a help message

      • registerOption

        public final void registerOption(java.lang.String flagId,
                  java.lang.String tooltip,
                  char shortFlag,
                  java.lang.String longFlag,
                  boolean argExpected)
        Registers a new option
        Parameters:
        flagId - an unique id to identify this option
        tooltip - a description to be printed in a help message to explain this option
        shortFlag - a unique printable char to enable this option or NoShortFlag
        longFlag - a unique string literal to enable this option or NoLongFlag
        argExpected - trueif this option needs a additional value

      • setValue

        public final void setValue(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
        Sets all flagIds given in this map as enabled and copies the values.
        Parameters:
        values - map with set of pairs of flagId, value
